titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of the Records, 1972-1990, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Abel Ramirez

profiledesc.creation: Text converted and initial EAD tagging provided by Apex Data Services, February 2001.

change.item: urn:taro:ttu.sw.00079 converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (20030505).

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Nuclear Waste Management Records, 1972-1990
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Nuclear Waste Management Records, 1972-1990
did.abstract: The records pertain to the efforts to establish nuclear waste disposal sites in several states in the 1980s and the opposition of such a site in Deaf Smith County, Texas.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: In the 1980s the U. S. Department of Energy led an effort to establish nuclear waste disposal sites in several states, one of which was Texas. The site selected was in Deaf Smith County. The proposal for Deaf Smith County fell through because of protests from the local community. Opposition was due in part to concerns for the Ogallala aquifer and the agricultural production. Leading the protests were the organizations of Serious Texans Against Nuclear Dumping, headquartered in Tulia, Texas, and the People Opposed to Wasted Energy Repositories, headquartered in Hereford, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection on nuclear waste management contains bound books, policy readers, proceedings, Department of Energy papers and publications, news clippings, community audits, annual reports to Congress, policies, and mission statements.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Nuclear Waste Management Records, 1972-1990, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Smith, Billy L. How West Texas Newspapers Covered the Nuclear Waste-Dump Site Selection Process. Thesis (M.A.)--Texas Tech University, 1989.

Low-level Radioactive Waste Disposal Authority Act: Chapter 273, Acts of the 67th Legislature of the state of Texas, Regular session, 1981: Article 4590f-1, Vernon's Texas civil statutes. Austin: Texas Low-level Radioactive Waste Disposal Authority, 1984.
